meanings.definition: To transport (a sick or injured person) by helicopter or airplane to a hospital for emergency medical treatment.
meanings.sent1: The injured hiker was medevaced to the hospital after falling down the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The medical team medevaced the patient to the trauma center for immediate care.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat got medevaced from the tree after climbing too high.
meanings.sent4: The ambulance couldn't reach the remote location, so a helicopter medevaced the patient instead.
meanings.sent5: The storm made it impossible for the ground ambulance to reach the accident site, so they had to medevac the injured driver.

meanings.sent4: The medevac of the injured athlete symbolized the importance of quick medical response.
